We didn’t want to build a hiring tool. We had to.As an early stage company, hiring the right candidates for us is critical, but it’s tough. Really really tough.Manually going through resumes was too difficult and the hiring platforms didn’t seem to allow the customisations that we wanted.And so, we built our own hiring platform. KubeHire!We designed it for quick and accurate screening of candidates. We use custom evaluation scripts and AI to shortlist candidates and give them a relevancy score ensuring that the most relevant ones rise to the top.With over 8000 applications until now, we haven’t faced any issues with it, and even within the sea of applicants, we can see which candidate is fit for us without spending hours. The best part is we have full control and can customise the platform as per our needs. Are you an early stage company looking for the right hiring platform? Do get in touch if you're interesting in trying out KubeHire. hashtag#devops hashtag#hiring hashtag#kubenine

Welcoming the new month and Eid-al-Fitr with new job opportunities from hashtag#LokerWithPiki!On behalf of Satrio Consulting, I'm looking for outstanding hashtag#techtalents who are interested in hashtag#KaburAjaDulu by joining our Japanese SaaS client for these available positions:1. Sr. Software Engineer, Backend -- 7+ YoEFor this position, you will be working on developing the product. Thus, you are not required to have experience with Kubernetes and Docker at all.2. Sr. Software Engineer, Backend (Workflow Engine) -- 7+ YoEUnlike the previous one, this position requires you to have experience with Kubernetes and Docker, as you're going to work specifically in the workflow engine itself.3. Sr. Software Engineer, Backend (DevOps) -- 7+ YoEIn case you've ever found this position in a different platform I use, it was previously listed as Tech Lead (Platform/DevEx Engineering). We are welcoming candidates with experience in DevOps or Platform Engineering.4. Sr. Software Engineer, Frontend (Platform/Frontend Improvement) -- 7+ YoEFor this position, you will be responsible for developing shared UI/UX components to improve development productivity.For detailed requirements, please read the attached document.What can our client provide for you?- Annual Salary Range: JPY 8.5 - 12 million- Other benefits: visa and relocation support providedIf you believe that you're qualified for this role, where do you send your latest CV?You can send your latest CV to vickyfarhan95@gmail.com and put the position you want to apply for as the subject.But remember, I will contact qualified candidates only to continue to the initial call. If you have already applied for this opportunity and have been rejected by our client, you are eligible to reapply one year after your last recruitment process with the company!hashtag#hiring hashtag#careerinjapan hashtag#saas hashtag#techjobs hashtag#softwareengineeringjobs hashtag#backendengineers hashtag#frontendengineers hashtag#devops hashtag#workflow hashtag#rust hashtag#typescript hashtag#reactjs hashtag#nodejs

We didn’t want to build a hiring tool. We had to.As an early stage company, hiring the right candidates for us is critical, but it’s tough. Really really tough.Manually going through resumes was too difficult and the hiring platforms didn’t seem to allow the customisations that we wanted.And so, we built our own hiring platform. KubeHire!We designed it for quick and accurate screening of candidates. We use custom evaluation scripts and AI to shortlist candidates and give them a relevancy score ensuring that the most relevant ones rise to the top.With over 8000 applications until now, we haven’t faced any issues with it, and even within the sea of applicants, we can see which candidate is fit for us without spending hours. The best part is we have full control and can customise the platform as per our needs. Are you an early stage company looking for the right hiring platform? Do get in touch if you're interesting in trying out KubeHire. hashtag#devops hashtag#hiring hashtag#kubenine

When you’re a pure bootstrap founder,you don’t wear one hat—you wear every hat.In the last 1.5 years,I’ve gone from writing code…✅ to manage marketing campaigns,✅ to handling support calls,✅ to designing UI screens at 1 AM.Here’s what I’ve been doing at Bill Saathi:🎯 Programming (yep, still sometimes) + Sales calls + Marketing strategy + Customer support + Graphic design + UI/UX + DevOps + HR & hiring + And honestly, much more.🤔 At first, I thought,“Who will do all this?”But when you're bootstrapped—you have to find a way.You start with no budget, no team, just belief.You learn under pressure.And somehow, you make it work.Skills can be learned.But only when you’re truly in the game.Want to know how I managed all this solo?Drop me a DM. We didn’t want to build a hiring tool. We had to.As an early stage company, hiring the right candidates for us is critical, but it’s tough. Really really tough.Manually going through resumes was too difficult and the hiring platforms didn’t seem to allow the customisations that we wanted.And so, we built our own hiring platform. KubeHire!We designed it for quick and accurate screening of candidates. We use custom evaluation scripts and AI to shortlist candidates and give them a relevancy score ensuring that the most relevant ones rise to the top.With over 8000 applications until now, we haven’t faced any issues with it, and even within the sea of applicants, we can see which candidate is fit for us without spending hours. The best part is we have full control and can customise the platform as per our needs. Are you an early stage company looking for the right hiring platform? 🎬 Episode 3 of "On and Off the Field" We're excited to share another behind-the-scenes look at life in our engineering team! This week, we're featuring Daniel Pina, our DevOps Discipline Lead, as he walks us through his journey at Hawk-Eye Innovations Ltd, the impact of his work, and what he enjoys beyond the job.
